p: Chemical control strategies, widely used during the 1970s, have been minimized after the development of monitoring systems, biological control strategies, and the agroecological approach. Nevertheless, there is a widespread desire to use more agrochemicals among farmers, especially synthetic fertilizers, contradicting the perception of Cubaâ€™s focus on agroecology [ 60]. Synthetic pesticides are still used regularly for intensive crops, such as potato and tomato [ 23]. Moreover, and despite ecological awareness of their risks, farmers occasionally use synthetic pesticides in urban settings because of high efficiency and little work effort.
